properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters of Swain's Island; Coastal waters of Manua; Coastal waters of Tututila and Aunuu
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued February 13 at 6:50PM SBT by NWS Pago Pago AS
properties.description:
Gale force winds are expected to impact surrounding waters of American
Samoa within 48 hours. A possible developing tropical cyclone embedded
within an active monsoon trough to the northwest of the Samoa Island
Chain, is anticipated to bring northeast winds of at least 35 knots,
with higher gusts, and seas up to 20 feet. Seas and winds are much
higher near thunderstorms.

Gale force winds and dangerous seas could capsize or damage vessels
and the frequent showers could reduce visibility.

Mariners should consider altering plans to avoid possible hazardous
conditions. Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or
secure the vessel for severe wind and seas.

Listen to NOAA Weather Radio for the latest updates. You may also
follow us on Facebook "NWSPagoPago" or our website at www.weather.gov/ppg.

NWSheadline: A Gale Watch is in effect for American Samoa coastal waters
